title: 109_s3584
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, including interactive instructor-based training on developing goals and objectives with employees. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 requires supervisors to engage in various activities such as setting goals, mentoring employees, managing performance, and receiving training on prohibited personnel practices. Experienced supervisors also mentor new supervisors to transfer knowledge and skills. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates that supervisors participate in mentoring programs where experienced supervisors transfer knowledge in communication, critical thinking, and teamwork to new supervisors. Supervisors must complete these programs within a year of appointment and every three years thereafter. The Office of Personnel Management will oversee agency compliance with these requirements. Management will establish regulations for agency compliance with the Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006. The Office of Personnel Management will issue regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The amendments will take effect 180 days after enactment and apply to new supervisors appointed after that date. Supervisors employed before the effective date must complete training programs under the Federal Supervisor Training Act every 3 years. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCY STANDARDS. Management competency standards are being amended in Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance to agencies on the standards supervisors must meet to effectively manage employee performance. Each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors based on the guidance provided. Each agency must assess supervisor capacity and implement training programs to address identified issues. Agencies are required to submit progress reports annually to the Office of Personnel Management. Amendments are made to the table of sections for Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code. Amendments are made to management competency standards and regulations in Section 4305 and 4306 of title 5, United States Code.
